subject: Professional Education
question: What is the primary goal of education according to John Dewey?
choices: A) Memorization of facts
B) Development of critical thinking
C) Preparation for life through experience
D) Academic excellence
answer: C) Preparation for life through experience
svg: <svg width="60" height="60" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M12 2L3 7L12 12L21 7L12 2Z" stroke="#3B82F6" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/><path d="M3 17L12 22L21 17" stroke="#3B82F6" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/><path d="M3 12L12 17L21 12" stroke="#3B82F6" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/></svg>

subject: Professional Education
question: Which learning theory emphasizes the role of reinforcement?
choices: A) Constructivism
B) Behaviorism
C) Cognitivism
D) Humanism
answer: B) Behaviorism
svg: <svg width="60" height="60" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M9 12L11 14L15 10" stroke="#10B981" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/><circle cx="12" cy="12" r="9" stroke="#10B981" strokeWidth="2"/></svg>

subject: General Education
question: What is the unit of electrical resistance?
choices: A) Ampere
B) Volt
C) Ohm
D) Watt
answer: C) Ohm
svg: <svg width="60" height="60" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M13 2L3 14H12L11 22L21 10H12L13 2Z" stroke="#F59E0B" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/></svg>

subject: General Education
question: Who wrote 'Noli Me Tangere'?
choices: A) Andres Bonifacio
B) Jose Rizal
C) Emilio Aguinaldo
D) Antonio Luna
answer: B) Jose Rizal
svg: <svg width="60" height="60" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M4 19.5A2.5 2.5 0 0 1 6.5 17H20" stroke="#8B5CF6" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/><path d="M6.5 2H20V22H6.5A2.5 2.5 0 0 1 4 19.5V4.5A2.5 2.5 0 0 1 6.5 2Z" stroke="#8B5CF6" strokeWidth="2" strokeLinecap="round" strokeLinejoin="round"/></svg>

subject: Professional Education
question: What does 'scaffolding' mean in educational context?
choices: A) Building physical structures
B) Providing temporary support for learning
C) Creating lesson plans
D) Organizing classroom furniture
answer: B) Providing temporary support for learning

subject: Professional Education
question: In the formulation of classroom regulations, which of the following should a teacher refrain from doing?
choices: a. State classroom regulation as clearly as possible
b. Teacher and the class should make as many regulations as possible
c. Enlist student aid in the formation of classroom regulation
d. Enforce classroom regulations consistently and fairly
answer: b. Teacher and the class should make as many regulations as possible

subject: Professional Education
question: Zero standard deviation means that:
choices: a. The students scores are the same
b. 50% of the scores obtained is zero
c. More than 50% of the score obtained is zero
d. Less than 50% of the scores obtained is zero
answer: a. The students scores are the same

subject: Professional Education
question: Which is the least authentic mode of assessment?
choices: a. Paper-and-pencil test in vocabulary
b. Oral performance to assess student's spoken communication skills
c. Experiments in science to assess skill in the use of scientific methods
d. Artist production for music or art subject
answer: a. Paper-and-pencil test in vocabulary

subject: Professional Education
question: In what period of a child is physical growth fastest?
choices: a. Prenatal period
b. Early adolescence
c. Early childhood
d. Prenatal and early adolescence
answer: a. Prenatal period

subject: Professional Education
question: How does fear affect the voluntariness of an act?
choices: a. Makes the act involuntary
b. No effect at all
c. Increases voluntariness
d. Lessens but not destroy voluntariness
answer: d. Lessens but not destroy voluntariness

subject: Professional Education
question: A group of people asserts that their culture is superior to another. This exemplifies:
choices: a. Cultural gap
b. Ethnocentrism
c. Cultural conflict
d. Norm conflict
answer: b. Ethnocentrism

subject: Professional Education
question: A test consists of a graph showing the relationship between age and population. Follow a series of true-false items based on the graph. Which type of test does this illustrate?
choices: a. Laboratory exercise
b. Interpretative
c. Problem solving
d. Performance
answer: b. Interpretative

subject: Professional Education
question: Which curricular move served to strengthen spiritual and ethical values?
choices: a. Integration of creative thinking in all subject
b. Introduction of Value Education as a separate subject area
c. Reducing the number of subject areas into the skill subject
d. Re-introducing Science as all subject in Grade 1
answer: b. Introduction of Value Education as a separate subject area

subject: Professional Education
question: A teacher is a facilitator of learning and of the development of the youth. Which practice is not keeping with his role as facilitator?
choices: a. Considers the multiple intelligences of learners
b. Humiliates misbehaving pupils
c. Dialogs with parents and with other members of the community
d. Keeps himself abreast with educational trends
answer: b. Humiliates misbehaving pupils

subject: Professional Education
question: Which one indicates a teacher's genuine enthusiasm and pride in teaching?
choices: a. Sticking to teaching for the moment that there are no better offers
b. Telling everyone that he went to teaching for there was no other choice then
c. Engaging himself in continuing professional education
d. Belittling the remuneration one gets from teaching
answer: c. Engaging himself in continuing professional education

subject: Professional Education
question: In writing performance objective which word is not acceptable?
choices: a. Manipulate
b. Integrate
c. Delineate
d. Comprehend
answer: d. Comprehend

subject: Professional Education
question: When is giving praise ineffective? When it?
choices: a. Uses the accomplishment of peers as the context for describing a student's present accomplishment
b. Provides information to student's about their competence and the value of their accomplishment
c. Focuses students attention on her own task relevant behavior
d. Shows spontaneity, variety and other signs of credibility
answer: a. Uses the accomplishment of peers as the context for describing a student's present accomplishment

subject: Professional Education
question: Which statement applies when scores distribution is negatively skewed?
choices: a. The mode corresponds to a lower value
b. The median is higher that the mode
c. The mode and median are equal
d. The mean corresponds to a high value
answer: b. The median is higher that the mode

subject: Professional Education
question: The use of the process approach gives the student the opportunity to:
choices: a. Learn to their own
b. Apply the scientific method
c. Learn how to learn
d. Make use of laboratory apparatuses
answer: b. Apply the scientific method

subject: Professional Education
question: A comprehension skill of higher level which may be inferred or implied from reading is:
choices: a. Picking out the main idea
b. Drawing conclusion
c. Nothing specific details
d. Following direction
answer: b. Drawing conclusion

subject: Professional Education
question: In the Preamble of the Code of Ethics of Professional Teachers, which is not mention about teachers?
choices: a. Dully licensed professionals
b. Posses dignity and reputation
c. LET passers
d. With high moral values
answer: c. LET passers

subject: Professional Education
question: What does a skewed score distribution mean?
choices: a. The scores are concentrated more at one end or the other end
b. The mode, the mean and the median are equal
c. The mean and median are equal
d. The scores are normally distributed
answer: a. The scores are concentrated more at one end or the other end

subject: Professional Education
question: What is implied by a negatively skewed score distribution?
choices: a. The scores are evenly distributed from the left to the right
b. Most pupils are underachieves
c. Most of the scores are high
d. Most of the scores are low
answer: c. Most of the scores are high

subject: Professional Education
question: A teacher discovers that a product of a certain bottling company brings about damage to teeth. Much as he wants to share the products of his research, he could not because of harassment from all sides. Which teacher's right is violated?
choices: a. Right to property
b. Academic freedom
c. Right to one's honor
d. Right to make a livelihood
answer: b. Academic freedom

subject: Professional Education
question: Why can the calculator do arithmetic? Because:
choices: a. A computer inside the calculator tells it how
b. A watch inside direct it
c. A typewriter inside does it
d. A TV inside shows it
answer: a. A computer inside the calculator tells it how

subject: Professional Education
question: On which constitutional provision is the full or partial integration of capable deaf and blind students in the classroom based? The provision on:
choices: a. Protecting and promoting the right of all citizen to qualify education
b. Providing citizenship and vocational training to adult citizen
c. Academic freedom
d. Creating scholarship for poor and deserving students
answer: a. Protecting and promoting the right of all citizen to qualify education

subject: Professional Education
question: Teaching in the cognitive, psychomotor and effective domains is based on the concept that the learner is a:
choices: a. Moral and feeling being
b. Maternal and an acting being
c. Thinking, feeling and acting being
d. Spiritual and maternal being
answer: c. Thinking, feeling and acting being

subject: Professional Education
question: Both Muslim and Christian value marriage but the Muslim practices polygamous marriage while the Christian practices monogamous marriage. What is this called?
choices: a. Cultural relativism
b. Acculturation
c. Ethical relativism
d. Enculturation
answer: a. Cultural relativism

subject: Professional Education
question: Teacher wants to compare 2 concepts. With which technique can accomplish this best?
choices: a. K-W-L technique
b. Venn diagram
c. Spider web
d. Histogram
answer: b. Venn diagram

subject: Professional Education
question: To build a sense of pride among Filipino youth what should be done?
choices: a. Re-study our history and stress on our achievements as a people
b. Set aside the study of local history
c. Re-study our history from the perspective of our colonizers
d. Replace the study of folklores and myths with technical subjects
answer: a. Re-study our history and stress on our achievements as a people

subject: Professional Education
question: When necessary conditions are present, the use of inductive method is preferred because:
choices: a. It gives the teacher more time to rest
b. There is greater active participation on the part of the pupils
c. It needs only few instruction materials
d. Academic time is used wisely
answer: b. There is greater active participation on the part of the pupils

subject: Professional Education
question: Which is the best reason why teacher begins a lesson in Math by checking and reviewing on the previous day's assignment and provides practice and drills?
choices: a. Check if parents guide their children in the making of assignment
b. Make sure that the students understand the pre-requisite skills of the lesson
c. Prepare the students for the mastery test
d. Make learning interesting and enjoyable for students
answer: b. Make sure that the students understand the pre-requisite skills of the lesson

subject: Professional Education
question: Which is a selective reading technique meant at getting at important facts very fast?
choices: a. Skim reading
b. Scanning
c. Oral reading
d. Silent reading
answer: b. Scanning

subject: Professional Education
question: For counseling to be successful which assumption must be avoided?
choices: a. The environment must provide assurance of confidentiality
b. The counselor tells the student what to do
c. The student is willing to participate in the process
d. The counselor must be able to relate to the student
answer: b. The counselor tells the student what to do

subject: Professional Education
question: Which technique is most appropriate when a teacher wants a group to agree on a plan of action?
choices: a. Composite report
b. Consensus decision making
c. Symposium
d. Agenda
answer: b. Consensus decision making

subject: Professional Education
question: What term applies to the search for related literature by computing access of databases of discs kept in libraries?
choices: a. Compact discs computer research
b. On line research
c. Manual research
d. Computer research
answer: a. Compact discs computer research

subject: Professional Education
question: What best indicates the effectiveness of classroom activities?
choices: a. The laughter and enjoyment of students
b. The application of concept learned in daily life
c. The utilization of varied techniques and approaches
d. The variety of instructional materials used
answer: b. The application of concept learned in daily life

subject: Professional Education
question: The main purpose of the compulsory study of the Constitution in Philippine schools is to:
choices: a. Develop the students into responsible thinking citizens
b. Acquaint students with the historical development of the Philippine Constitution
c. Prepare students for law making
d. Make constitutional experts of the students
answer: a. Develop the students into responsible thinking citizens

subject: Professional Education
question: Some students who are high in the scholastic aptitude test have failed in college. Some who are below the standards set for admission but who for various reasons were admitted, attained satisfactory standings. This proves that:
choices: a. Human beings are certainly predictable
b. Admission tests are not accurate, hence should not be used
c. Aptitude tests do not measure all factors important for success
d. Aptitude test can be perfectly relied on
answer: c. Aptitude tests do not measure all factors important for success

subject: Professional Education
question: If the teachers pattern in questioning consists of calling on a student then asking the question:
choices: a. All students may be encouraged to participate
b. The student called to answer may be able to think well of his answer
c. The rest of the class may just dictate the answer
d. The rest of the class may not engage themselves in thinking of the answer
answer: d. The rest of the class may not engage themselves in thinking of the answer

subject: Professional Education
question: Freud expounded that there is a period when young girls experience rivalry with their mother for their father's affection. This is called:
choices: a. Electra complex
b. Oedipus complex
c. Achilles syndrome
d. Cassandra syndrome
answer: a. Electra complex

subject: Professional Education
question: Education is a lifelong process. This simply means that education:
choices: a. May take place formally or informally to enable the individual to grow
b. May take place anywhere and anytime the individual so desires
c. Is a continuous process of experiencing and reorganizing experiences
d. Take place in the school where the individual is exposed, self contained experiences
answer: c. Is a continuous process of experiencing and reorganizing experiences

subject: Professional Education
question: The tendency to imitate elders is very strong in the early childhood stage. Teachers should therefore be very good:
choices: a. Counselors
b. Role models
c. Disciplinarians
d. Facilitators of learning
answer: b. Role models

subject: Professional Education
question: How is Values Education offered in the National Secondary Education Curriculum?
choices: a. Emphasized in Science and Technology
b. Integrated in all subject areas
c. As a separate subject
d. Integrated with Technology and Home Economics
answer: b. Integrated in all subject areas

subject: Professional Education
question: The NSEC orients secondary education to:
choices: a. The teaching of the national symbols
b. Health values development
c. The development of competencies and values for social living
d. National development requirement and reflects search based direction
answer: c. The development of competencies and values for social living

subject: Professional Education
question: The child cannot distinguish abstracts during the sensory motor of development. Which of these techniques should a teacher apply to accommodate learning?
choices: a. Make use of individualize instruction
b. Explain the lesson very well
c. Utilize concrete objects to clarify concept
d. Provide variety of educational toys
answer: c. Utilize concrete objects to clarify concept

subject: Professional Education
question: Which of these systems of learning includes ways and methods which are used in preserving and building certain within cultural communities?
choices: a. Non-formal learning
b. Multi-level learning
c. Cultural learning
d. Indigenous learning
answer: d. Indigenous learning

subject: Professional Education
question: Which of the following statement is true in the use of experiments and demonstrations in teaching Science:
choices: a. It is valuable if used in the context of a lesson that related observation to other information
b. It should be encouraged in elementary school since the concept the encompass are difficult for your children
c. It is as valuable as teaching by lecturing
d. It is less valuable than teaching through inquiry and discussion
answer: a. It is valuable if used in the context of a lesson that related observation to other information

subject: Professional Education
question: Identical twins are more alike than fraternal twins. Which of the following statement principle supported by this?
choices: a. Environment affects both fraternal and identical twins
b. Intelligence hinges in physical structure
c. Heredity has a part in determining intelligence
d. Intelligence is determined partly by pre-natal nutrition
answer: c. Heredity has a part in determining intelligence

subject: Professional Education
question: In testing which of the following is referred to as cultural bias?
choices: a. Some culture do better on test than others
b. Test items are more familiar with some culture
c. Test will show who is more cultured
d. Cultured people do better on tests
answer: b. Test items are more familiar with some culture

subject: Professional Education
question: Which is the most obvious and familiar way of reporting variability?
choices: a. Standard deviation
b. Range between highest with some culture
c. Standard error of the mean
d. Distribution of raw scores
answer: a. Standard deviation

subject: Professional Education
question: The theory of identical elements in learning holds that transfer is facilitated when the:
choices: a. Teacher uses different teaching devices
b. Learner has a memory of specific responses
c. Development task is easily identified
d. Experience is similar to the application situation
answer: d. Experience is similar to the application situation

subject: Professional Education
question: If this need is not met, the adolescent tends to be critical and always tries to find fault. This is the need:
choices: a. For adventure
b. For recognition
c. To belong
d. For material security
answer: b. For recognition

subject: Professional Education
question: The way a child talks and walks manifest gestures that have been learned from models he had been exposed. This explains what influence?
choices: a. Affective
b. Insight
c. Social
d. Cognitive
answer: c. Social

subject: Professional Education
question: Audio-visual aids are used in classroom teaching to _________.
choices: a. Help make learning more permanent
b. All of these
c. Help clarify important concept
d. Arouse and sustain student's interest
answer: b. All of these
